The relationship between y and its image under K is described through a convolution, i.e., \\( K*y = \\int h(t) y(x-t) dt \\), where h(t) is an impulse response function. We are interested in how the application of Fourier Transform (\\( \\mathcal{F} \\)) might influence this relationship.

Can we determine whether an intervention (changing h(t) to g(t)) occurred, by only observing the Fourier Transform of the convolution result at a later stage?

Without knowing the initial or intermediate states exactly, it is infeasible to pinpoint the specific intervention solely from the result.
